result.execSummary:
All charges against Adryanna James Armstrong in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adryanna James Armstrong is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant did not appear at the 2pm hearing - court set out to May 3, 2022 1:30PM

11:40 AM Defendant Adryanna James Armstrong not in court.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adryanna James Armstrong.  Court notes JA received message that defendant would be late.  Atty Schiek statement - has to be somewhere and can't wait around.  Court sets over to this afternoon at 2 p.m.

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adryanna James Armstrong in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Adryanna James Armstrong. Calling 22CM52, 22CM9, 22TR37, 22TR38 & 22TR336 - 22TR340. 22TR37 to be addressed today. Schiek will refile charge in other case. Defendant pleads no contest to 22TR37. Court finds guilty and issues fine of $937.00 - AODA and driver safety plan - 6 months IID & 6 months drivers license revocation. fine due to COC office within 60 days or set up a payment plan. Court will set other cases out. Bond continued. adj. 02:23 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adryanna James Armstrong appeared in court. Attorney Breanna Magallones appearing in court - will be appointed. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Bail continued. adj. . Bail continued. adj. 02:54 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Adryanna James Armstrong appeared by video. Calling 22CM9, 22TR37 & 22TR38. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant states she is eligible for PD. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on address. Court sets bond. Complaint and bond to be sent for signature. adj. 01:39 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
